A Moment of Truth

A tense room, two men facing each other.  
Porfiry speaks earnestly.  
Porfiry: “I want to clear the misunderstanding.”  

Raskolnikov shifts uncomfortably.  
Raskolnikov: “What do you mean?”  
Porfiry: “You’ve suffered, but you’re noble.”  

---  

Porfiry maintains eye contact, sincerity in his voice.  
Porfiry: “I don’t want to deceive you.”  
Raskolnikov feels a rush of alarm.  
Raskolnikov: “Why do you care?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Porfiry Petrovitch expresses his desire to clarify misunderstandings with Raskolnikov and acknowledges the suffering caused by their interactions.
